intro: Artabotrys camptopetalus, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its pendulous, yellowish-green flowers that resemble small showers, hence its common name. The plant belongs to the family Annonaceae and is known for its fragrant blooms. It typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. The leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture, contributing to its ornamental value.
